@bossladyCX 100%, @bossladyCX! Same principle applies to customers.

Hot take! Instead of making a list for *new* #tech in the #cctr, many would be wise to focus on optimizing *existing* tech. I‚Äôm seeing lots of folks shelling out $ for the latest & greatest, but failing to improve what‚Äôs already in place. Can‚Äôt layer new tech on bad foundations!
@jtwatkin @AilsDay @tanujdiwan @stephaniethum @DebbieSzumylo @cx_scott @kendalrodgers_ @CxExcellence @EdifyCMO @heycxguy @globaldenton https://t.co/1NnI0HlWWe

@jtwatkin @NicholasZeisler @CustomerIsFirst @JoshRaps @loyaltyrocks @luismelo78 @AnshulBahl @milescthomas @Schulbz @drumondmary @LilianaPetrova @rnanjad @ClareMuscutt @avdingus @AilsDay #CX leaders should continue to‚Ä¶ 

Ask hard questions. Welcome tough answers.

Challenge the status quo. 

Embrace small, incremental change. 

Champion the needs of the frontline folks serving & supporting customers. 

Rest. Recharge. This is hard, lifelong work! 

#CXQOTD

@jtwatkin @tanujdiwan @IngridsPaixaoz @cx_scott @NicholasZeisler @seatoncx @CxExcellence @thecallcenterc1 @heycxguy @SeanBHawkins @cxcentricglobal @mundocx @theccdoctor @sudhbhat @NTIatHome @Scottywerner1 Nope; they sure aren‚Äôt! 

But I like to say‚Ä¶ 

The customer isn‚Äôt always right, but they *always* deserve to be heard. 

#CXQOTD

@jtwatkin @SeanBHawkins @TomRichard11 @JeremyHyde_ @_Glenna_Mae @cx_scott @esmancuso @toister @dave_dyson @RoyAtkinson @theccdoctor @thecallcenterc1 @RehbeinDanny Knowing =/= doing! Mgrs should have foundational & practical understanding of all workflows, processes, pain points, etc., but don‚Äôt need to know all the hows. Must shadow, listen, and learn from #frontline. But #1 focus should be coaching & working on the biz, not in it. #CXQOTD

@jennysuedempsey @jtwatkin @LeslieO @AilsDay @NealDlin @mrpatto @stephaniethum I‚Äôm obsessed. If it was the only thing that was healthy and sustainable to eat‚Ä¶ I would only eat it. I have strong cheese opinions - let‚Äôs talk. üòÇ üßÄ https://t.co/S4oasAIyWh

9/30 #CXQOTD:

‚ÄúHow do you evaluate #CX maturity?‚Äù 

I like to consider:

1) Is the practice (it) aligned to the org‚Äôs strategic plan? 

2) Does it have clearly defined objectives & measures of success? 

3) Does it deliver fair returns on invested resources?

What say you? üßµüëá

@toister @AilsDay @jtwatkin @LeslieO @thecallcenterc1 @theccdoctor @AlexAllwood @zjellson @dave_dyson @laurenqvolpe @AllanPease Just another reason #cctr leaders need to take a critical look at agent-level performance #metrics and remove targets that incentivize rushed outcomes! #CXQOTD

@AilsDay @jtwatkin @toister @LeslieO @thecallcenterc1 @theccdoctor @AlexAllwood @zjellson @dave_dyson @laurenqvolpe @AllanPease Maybe a simple answer but‚Ä¶ active listening. Listening to understand vs. listening to solve. Especially in high demand #custserv environments. Sometimes we need to unpack the backpack to truly identify emotional needs, and too often we‚Äôre in problem solve mode.  #CXQOTD
I needed this reminder today! Thanks, @stephaniethum. #CXQOTD

‚ÄúNumbers require narrative.‚Äù 
It‚Äôs easy to lose the humanity in metrics, targets, & KPIs. When we remember that numbers are here to *help* us tell a story/understand a problem, not definitively define success/answer questions, we open space to keep people at the ‚ù§Ô∏è of our work.

#CXQOTD - 9/23 ‚ú® 

‚ÄúWhat quote, phrase, or motto do you live by as a #CX practitioner or ally, and why?‚Äù

Mine? See the üßµ üëá 

What‚Äôs yours? @jennysuedempsey @sherikendall @stephaniethum @CustomerIsFirst @kayejchapman @chrishannashow @stacysherman @NealDlin @CXpert @AilsDay
@jtwatkin @tanujdiwan @stephaniethum @LeslieO @DebbieSzumylo @NicholasZeisler @rnanjad @CXpert @heycxguy @AilsDay @globaldenton https://t.co/m0j0BPqrmi

@jtwatkin @theccdoctor @NicholasZeisler @CxExcellence @heycxguy @michelleRPO @AilsDay @TomRichard11 @SeanBHawkins @tanujdiwan @ddu17 Yes, but it always depends on what the ‚Äústandard‚Äù is. Do they always need a degree? Probably not. If they‚Äôre customer-facing, do they need emotional intelligence? Absolutely. Sometimes the impact of a vacant spot is bigger than cost of investing in time training/coaching. #CXQOTD

@luismelo78 Sounds like you shouldn‚Äôt have needed the bot at all if the appointment booking option/link was made readily and appropriately available across digital assets like the main website! Was that not the case, @luismelo78? Just a curiosity Q as I dive into a few PX projects üôÇ

@jtwatkin @LeslieO @toister @justinmrobbins @JeremyHyde_ @SeanBHawkins @TomRichard11 @sherikendall @jennysuedempsey @thecallcenterc1 @theccdoctor @NTIatHome @kayejchapman @NealTopf Don‚Äôt ignore cultivating & fostering productive, collaborative relationships w/adjacent depts for the sake of narrow, aggressive focus on CCTR ops. It‚Äôs easy to hoard data & insights & see others as barriers. Hard to dig out of. Invest in cross-functional relationships! #CXQOTD
@sherikendall @jtwatkin Yes, yes, yes! Love this, @sherikendall!

@jtwatkin @JeremyHyde_ @kendalrodgers_ @thecallcenterc1 @heycxguy @theccdoctor @kayejchapman @MrWhiteSaysThis @NealTopf @AilsDay @zjellson @TomRichard11 @jacobshields20 @SeanBHawkins I don‚Äôt have a specific answer here given current role‚Ä¶ but my question back to those who do respond (bc I‚Äôd like to know!) is the *why* behind the metrics shared? Is it habit, current biz focus, etc? And then, what do you do with your daily learnings/insights? #CXQOTD

@cx_scott @jtwatkin @NicholasZeisler @justinmrobbins @luismelo78 @heycxguy @mundocx @sudhbhat @NTIatHome @ndytg @NealDlin @NealTopf @AilsDay @zjellson @SteveDiGioia @jacobshields20 @avdingus @globaldenton Right. @jtwatkin @cx_scott @NicholasZeisler @justinmrobbins @luismelo78 @heycxguy @mundocx @sudhbhat @NTIatHome @ndytg @NealDlin @NealTopf @AilsDay @zjellson @SteveDiGioia @jacobshields20 @avdingus @globaldenton ‚ÄúOmnichannel orchestration‚Äù 

It‚Äôs too nebulous, and the phrasing grossly simplifies an exceptionally complex transformational process. It sounds fancy and cool, but what does it really mean, ya know? #CXQOTD

@jtwatkin @tanujdiwan @sherikendall @stacysherman @CustomerIsFirst @CXpert @rkirubi @jennysuedempsey @kayejchapman @CxExcellence @EJEngwall @esmancuso @LeslieO @justinmrobbins Boundaries üëèüèª boundaries üëèüèª 

Keeping the main things main requires us to set boundaries in every aspect of life. It also requires us to dig deep and remove people, things, or work that aren‚Äôt serving us well in this life. #CXQOTD

Thanks for having me, @verbaltransact! 

Tune in for a short and sweet chat on why I think using ‚Äúbad hire‚Äù language can be lazy, how orgs often fail to set up employees for success, and other musings on #EmployeeExperience

@stephaniethum @Ratul @JoshVoC @sudhbhat @psb_dc @stessacohen @dfriez @luismelo78 @ScottWLuton @rnanjad @jennysuedempsey @nicoledblake @CxExcellence @mishbatt @LaTonyaTeaches @esmancuso Only two?! Help! I like all of these.

@tanujdiwan @jtwatkin @jennysuedempsey @Hyken @LeslieO @SueDuris @NealDlin @seatoncx @CxExcellence @stephaniethum @sudhbhat @JuliaAhlfeldt @AlexAllwood @globaldenton @AilsDay @CXpert @cx_scott @heycxguy @esmancuso @stacysherman Then the most critical point is working with and guiding the brand to clearly define what they are looking to understand from their various segments. Too often we see brands adopt trigger quick/reactionary surveys w/out identifying their objective & goals for collecting feedback.

@tanujdiwan @jtwatkin @jennysuedempsey @Hyken @LeslieO @SueDuris @NealDlin @seatoncx @CxExcellence @stephaniethum @sudhbhat @JuliaAhlfeldt @AlexAllwood @globaldenton @AilsDay @CXpert @cx_scott @heycxguy @esmancuso @stacysherman What are we looking to understand, @tanujdiwan? My first reaction was that this sounds like survey fatigue/paralysis if we‚Äôre not segmenting properly & adding variety to feedback collection processes, as others mentioned. A 360 approach is key - VoC, VoE, Data, Social, & Product.
@kayejchapman @splunk Congrats on the new adventure, @kayejchapman! Wishing you well üôÇ

@JeremyHyde_ @theccdoctor @Hyken @toister @LeslieO @heycxguy @jennysuedempsey @bradcleveland @CXAccelerator @laurenqvolpe @Melchor_Eric @esmancuso @stephaniethum @CXpert @SteveDiGioia @DebbieSzumylo Desired outcome & root cause of problem we‚Äôre hoping to address can and should influence what we measure/track to determine success! Not disagreeing with other responses, but it‚Äôs always important to know what we‚Äôre solving for.

@theccdoctor @Hyken @toister @LeslieO @heycxguy @jennysuedempsey @bradcleveland @CXAccelerator @laurenqvolpe @Melchor_Eric @JeremyHyde_ @esmancuso @stephaniethum @CXpert @SteveDiGioia @DebbieSzumylo Need a bit more context - is the callback tech being introduced as a courtesy to bolster the CX by providing added convenience? Or, is it being introduced to mitigate unexpected volume? Both?

@StossInSupport Oh how true this is. Just because it‚Äôs not the way you (leader) would do it, doesn‚Äôt mean it‚Äôs wrong. Leaders who can‚Äôt grasp this and provide meaningful feedback without detaching themselves & their approach aren‚Äôt really leaders after all!
@NealDlin @jennysuedempsey @CustomerIsFirst @NealTopf @esmancuso @theccdoctor @sherikendall @LeslieO @DebbieSzumylo This warms my heart. Thanks for sharing üôÇ

You‚Äôve definitely inspired me to be more comfortable in sharing on social üôÇ
@DebbieSzumylo This is a GREAT compliment! Subtle yet so powerful. Kudos to you for crafting a story or narrative that landed and resonated - not always an easy task!

@tanujdiwan @jennysuedempsey @CustomerIsFirst @NealDlin @NealTopf @esmancuso @theccdoctor @sherikendall @LeslieO @DebbieSzumylo Love this! Did it help you learn and understand what CX really meant, felt, and looked like to that CX manager? I love compliments that also reveal intentions and value.

@esmancuso @jennysuedempsey @CustomerIsFirst @NealDlin @NealTopf @theccdoctor @sherikendall @LeslieO @DebbieSzumylo To me this signifies that you were not only willing and able to help guide someone, but that you presented the info in a way that was digestible and easy to retain. Packaging matters when reaching and helping someone learn. That‚Äôs not easy! üëèüèª
@LeslieO Ha! Hey, we‚Äôll take it, right? Thanks for sharing, @LeslieO. I can‚Äôt imagine any of your trainings being boring! Thanks for all you do üôÇ

@jtwatkin @dnm54 @EJEngwall @jimtincher @stacysherman @bbuckanonymous @Scottywerner1 @scottdraeger @JuliaAhlfeldt @globaldenton @kkmett @RussLoL @Hyken @rkirubi @Calinoz @RoyAtkinson @mikeaoki I‚Äôm a better self-serve detective (don‚Äôt default to üí∞ channels first), more patient, & avoid social screaming. When I get good help, I give extra praise. When I don‚Äôt, I don‚Äôt take it out on the agent. I do more research & social listening before committing/purchasing. #CXQOTD
I believe in this *so* deeply as a consultant. #cx #cctr #custserv

@NealDlin @jtwatkin @LeslieO @jennysuedempsey @JeremyHyde_ @SeanBHawkins @NealTopf @stealeyreed @dave_dyson @theccdoctor @thecallcenterc1 @TomRichard11 @justinmrobbins Thanks, Neal. Too often the metrics for ‚Äúsuccess‚Äù drive undesirable agent behavior and negative customer outcomes. Too many orgs get this wrong.

@jtwatkin @LeslieO @jennysuedempsey @JeremyHyde_ @SeanBHawkins @NealTopf @stealeyreed @dave_dyson @theccdoctor @thecallcenterc1 @TomRichard11 @justinmrobbins Beyond the greeting, the best way to begin a customer interaction is to be prepared! Agents should be logged in to relevant tools, & they should have quick & easy insight into the customer‚Äôs history w/the org. This shows respect for customer‚Äôs time & builds confidence. #CXQOTD

@jtwatkin @toister @ndytg @kayejchapman @sherikendall @dbeaumont266 @dave_dyson @stacysherman @CXpert @JeremyHyde_ @jennysuedempsey @DebbieSzumylo @RussLoL @mrpatto Great point! Orgs absolutely can lean in too heavily to making the onboarding exp shine while the true day to day exp is crap. Where does the potential for attrition spike most? Both are üîë but if both are bad‚Ä¶ which one gets prioritized for the LT health of the ppl & the biz?

@jennysuedempsey @ndytg @kayejchapman @sherikendall @dbeaumont266 @dave_dyson @stacysherman @CXpert @JeremyHyde_ @DebbieSzumylo @RussLoL @mrpatto Bingo! What are your thoughts on the sentiment that an org‚Äôs employees are their first customers, @jennysuedempsey? That‚Äôs what I first thought of here! #CXQOTD

@DebbieSzumylo That ‚ÄúA‚Äù word many of us have a love/hate relationship with‚Ä¶ attrition! Plus, the emotional toll feeling uncertain can take on a new person who often times is eager to do well and succeed. Thanks for sharing, @DebbieSzumylo! #CXQOTD

@sherikendall @ndytg @kayejchapman @dbeaumont266 @dave_dyson @stacysherman @CXpert @JeremyHyde_ @jennysuedempsey @DebbieSzumylo @RussLoL @mrpatto And we all understand how expensive stress, in its many forms, can be! Thanks for chiming in, @sherikendall! #CXQOTD

@mrpatto @ndytg @kayejchapman @sherikendall @dbeaumont266 @dave_dyson @stacysherman @CXpert @JeremyHyde_ @jennysuedempsey @DebbieSzumylo @RussLoL So true. What would you say is most important or urgent for folks to focus on when lobbying for a better #onboarding experience, @mrpatto - the productivity cost or the experiential cost? #CXQOTD

@dbeaumont266 @ndytg @kayejchapman @sherikendall @dave_dyson @stacysherman @CXpert @JeremyHyde_ @jennysuedempsey @DebbieSzumylo @RussLoL @mrpatto Yes! That instant sense of regret & maybe despair arrives and now the employee‚Äôs ‚Äúhealth‚Äù w/the org is at risk. And because they‚Äôre new, they probably don‚Äôt say anything‚Ä¶ driving longterm sentiment of feeling unwelcome or unequipped to be successful. Thanks for sharing! #CXQOTD
There‚Äôs good friction and there‚Äôs bad friction. Friction in the new hire #onboarding experience is bad friction. #CXQOTD

@RussLoL Love your answer! Resentment is an underrated cost in my opinion- it stays with the employee forever and slowly (or maybe quickly) eats away at their sense of job satisfaction, sense of worth, and well-being. Thanks for sharing! #CXQOTD

@tanujdiwan @ndytg @kayejchapman @sherikendall @dbeaumont266 @dave_dyson @stacysherman @CXpert @JeremyHyde_ @jennysuedempsey @DebbieSzumylo @RussLoL @mrpatto Sounds like this was an eye opening experience, @tanujdiwan, that drove a better process and positive outcomes. So glad you called out attrition - that is absolutely a huge (and avoidable!) cost to poor onboarding experiences. #CXQOTD

‚ÄúWhat is the cost of a poor new hire onboarding experience?‚Äù 

Share your thoughts!

@kayejchapman @jtwatkin @BeckyRoemen @jennysuedempsey @CustomerIsFirst @Hyken @LeslieO @jacobshields20 @SeanBHawkins @thatcxguytweets @theccdoctor Agreed! It‚Äôs not the norm, but there‚Äôs huge opportunity in doing so. The magic really happens when others in the biz take proactive steps to be curious, gain understanding, and repeatedly engage. Not ‚Äúeasy‚Äù and we can‚Äôt twiddle thumbs waiting for it... but it should happen more!

@kayejchapman @jtwatkin @BeckyRoemen @jennysuedempsey @CustomerIsFirst @Hyken @LeslieO @jacobshields20 @SeanBHawkins @thatcxguytweets @theccdoctor It peeves me that the burden of sharing what‚Äôs happening in the #cctr often always falls on the center itself. So, I‚Äôll get spicy here & say that execs, leaders, and employees across the biz should be coming IN themselves! Knock down those silos & learn for yourself! #CXQOTD

@jtwatkin @JeremyHyde_ @KayPhelpsTweets @jacobshields20 @sherikendall @esmancuso @HuskerHix @LeslieO @TomRichard11 @thecallcenterc1 @theccdoctor @scott_saas @mrpatto @jennysuedempsey Everyone who has replied has nailed it! Only thing I‚Äôll add is paid time to volunteer/engage in the local community. #CXQOTD

@jtwatkin @justinmrobbins @theccdoctor @Patrick_SaaS @KayPhelpsTweets @kayejchapman @dave_dyson @NealTopf @SeanBHawkins @TomRichard11 @thecallcenterc1 @NTIatHome @LeslieO @_Glenna_Mae AHT is tricky. Should be measured for WFM purposes but not exposed to agents. Pressure to adhere often drives undesirable agent behaviors and poor CX. Instead, concerns with agent AHT should be addressed via QM. And of course, root causes should be understood & improved. #CXQOTD
@stephaniethum No clear steps or path to resolution is what‚Äôs worse in my opinion!

I‚Äôm loving today‚Äôs question, @jtwatkin: 

Humility - we don‚Äôt know what we don‚Äôt know sometimes & that‚Äôs ok

Perseverance - to work through change and challenges with patience and grace 

Courage - to challenge the status quo, dream big, and work creatively 

#CXQOTD

A must have Chrome extension for anyone needing or wanting to update web copy for mock ups, design recommendations, or client presentations! Check out @Polishapp1 & give it a try. Great for #UX, #DigitalTransformation, and even #consulting! ü§ì

@sherikendall @jtwatkin @jennysuedempsey @BeckyRoemen @CustomerIsFirst @justinmrobbins Adding on that ‚Äúlittle‚Äù things are *big* things:

Do you know their birthday? Their partner‚Äôs name? What hobbies they enjoy? Do you ask them about these things? Do you say please/thank you? Do you keep up w/news in their area? Do you know what issues they care about? #CXQOTD

@stephaniethum Time. Time most precious resource that you can‚Äôt get back once wasted. 

Customer attention. One bad survey and they won‚Äôt pay attention to future opportunities to share feedback.

@jeanniecw @jtwatkin @NealTopf @globaldenton @theccdoctor @kayejchapman @DebbieSzumylo @jacobshields20 @avdingus @SeanBHawkins @ddu17 @adamtoporek @justinmrobbins @billquiseng @luismelo78 Thought explorer! I love that so much more than thought leader.

@esmancuso @jeanniecw @JeanneBliss @theccdoctor @stephaniethum @sherikendall @Press1ForNick @kayejchapman @djksar @DebbieSzumylo @justinmrobbins @ndytg @GauthierBeth @CXpert @CustomerIsFirst Sure is! Are we talking enough about trust when designing new customer experiences? I don‚Äôt think so!

@kkmett @jeanniecw @JeanneBliss @theccdoctor @stephaniethum @sherikendall @Press1ForNick @kayejchapman @djksar @DebbieSzumylo @justinmrobbins @ndytg @GauthierBeth @esmancuso @CXpert @CustomerIsFirst Agreed, @kkmett! More and more, I think customers are hesitant to trust companies - we carry past broken promises with us when we engage with new businesses. How can orgs better build trust up front with customers?

@DebbieSzumylo Love it, @DebbieSzumylo. In this case, trust becomes a form of emotional currency that allows companies to recover from mistakes or missed opportunities. When our relationship is rooted in trust, we get another opportunity to retain or expand wallet share & loyalty! Win win.

@stephaniethum @luismelo78 @CustomerIsFirst @theccdoctor @kkmett @Press1ForNick @DebbieSzumylo @esmancuso @jennysuedempsey @ndytg @AilsDay @mishbatt @AlexAllwood @djksar Such a great response, @stephaniethum. Your point about measuring customer trust is üîë- there are a lot of companies who simply trust that their customers trust them... with no concrete evidence supporting that belief. Big missed opportunity to measure what matters!

@jtwatkin @jeanniecw @JeanneBliss @theccdoctor @stephaniethum @sherikendall @Press1ForNick @kayejchapman @djksar @DebbieSzumylo @justinmrobbins @ndytg @GauthierBeth @esmancuso @CXpert @CustomerIsFirst Solving customers is an act of trust restoration. Love it, @jtwatkin! Thanks for sharing.
